sn17.13-20:1.2: “Mendicants, when I’ve comprehended the mind of a certain individual, I understand:
sn17.13-20:1.3: ‘This venerable would not tell a deliberate lie even for the sake of a gold ingot.’ …”
sn17.13-20:1.4: “‘… for the sake of a hundred gold ingots.’ …”
sn17.13-20:1.5: “‘… for the sake of a mountain of gold.’ …”
sn17.13-20:1.6: “‘… for the sake of a hundred mountains of gold.’ …”
sn17.13-20:1.7: “‘… for the sake of the whole earth full of gold.’ …”
sn17.13-20:1.8: “‘… for any kind of material reward.’ …”
sn17.13-20:1.10: “‘… for the sake of the finest lady in the land.’
sn17.13-20:1.11: But some time later I see them tell a deliberate lie because their mind is overcome and overwhelmed by possessions, honor, and popularity.
sn17.13-20:1.12: So grim are possessions, honor, and popularity. …”
